articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Back Home
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Back Home
 Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, came back home Monday after participating in the 15th NAM Summit held in Egypt. 
					 He was greeted at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the SPA, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, the Egyptian ambassador to the DPRK and the Chinese charge d'affaires ad interim to the DPRK.

articles.title: Greetings to Belgian King
articles.content:
Greetings to Belgian King
 Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Albert II, King of Belgium, on the occasion of its national day.
					 Kim in the message wished prosperity to Belgium.

articles.title: NAM Summit Supports DPRK's Efforts for Peace and Security
articles.content:
NAM Summit Supports DPRK's Efforts for Peace and Security
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The 15th NAM Summit, held in Egypt, expressed full support and solidarity with the DPRK striving for peace and security in the Korean Peninsula.
					 Especially, the member nations of the Non-Aligned Movement recognized that the "six-party talks" are needed no longer, and decided not to reflect this matter in the final document of the summit.
					
					 In this connection, the DPRK delegation expressed the conviction that the NAM would as ever extend invariable support to the just cause of the DPRK. And it reclarified the steadfast stand of the DPRK government to remain faithful to the idea of the NAM and make positive contribution to its strengthening and development in the future, too.

articles.title: North Hwanghae Provincial Taekwon-Do Team
articles.content:
North Hwanghae Provincial Taekwon-Do Team
 Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The 12th national Taekwon-Do championship for Jongilbong Cup was held recently with success amid deep interests of the martial art players and sports fans of the DPRK.
					  The North Hwanghae Provincial Taekwon-Do Team has been known throughout the country as a competent one for the victories won by it in all contests since its formation. In the recent championship, too, it ranked first on the gold medal table.
					
					 Jang Tong So, head of the team, said in an interview with KCNA:
					
					 In the recent championship, too, our players swept the gold medals in the individual and team pattern competitions by giving full play to their ability.
					
					 In the past our team has taken part in various national and international competitions including the national martial art championship for "September 10 Prize", the national Taekwon-Do technical renovation contests, world junior Taekwon-Do championships and Asian Taekwon-Do Championship, winning nearly 300 gold medals and 10-odd trophy  cups.
					
					 Our team has not conceded the first place in total points in the national Taekwon-Do championships for Jongilbong Cup by displaying the polished technique and collective spirit from Juche 92 (2003) when it was formed. 
					
					 Our capabilities were showed to the full in international games.
					
					 Our players placed first at the 6th and 7th world junior Taekwon-Do championships and the 4th Asian Taekwon-Do Championship to hoist the flag of the DPRK and glorify the honor of Taekwon-Do cradle-land.
					
					 At the 3rd International Martial Arts Games, our Taekwon-Doists (three players) bagged many gold medals by playing the games with confidence in sure victory and grit and thus placed first in standings of the countries.
					
					 Player Ri Hyang Mi, youngest as she was in age, career and game experience, beat the opponents by displaying her fortes and clinched three gold medals and was awarded top technical prize of the Asian Taekwon-Do Championship.
					
					 Over the years the team has produced a Merited Athlete, masters of sports, best coaches and players of the DPRK and lots of fine players who distinguished themselves in international competitions.
					
					 We will in the future, too, make every possible effort to develop the Taekwon-Do, traditional martial arts of the Korean nation, and to register fine results in all games.

articles.title: New Kind of Distemper Paint Developed
articles.content:
New Kind of Distemper Paint Developed
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- A new kind of distemper paint has been developed in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					It gives the texture effect of natural granite or marble to structures.
					
					The distemper paint of white, grey, red, light green and other colors is superior to other ones in qualitative property index including adhesive intensity.
					
					The production cost of the new paint, made of waste as main raw material, is a fifth of other ones and its serviceable life is far longer than the latter.
					
					It, which is applicable to the external and internal ornament of buildings including monuments, dwelling houses and public buildings, is being widely introduced in many units.

articles.title: Japan Hit for Being So Vociferous about "Combating Piracy"
articles.content:
Japan Hit for Being So Vociferous about "Combating Piracy"
 Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The international community should be as cautious about the frantic moves of the Japanese reactionaries for overseas invasion under the pretext of "anti- piracy measures" as it is vigilant against acts of pirates.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It was reported recently that the second contingent of the Japan Maritime "Self-Defense Force" left for the waters off Somalia under the pretext of "combating piracy" and is expected to arrive there around the end of July when the "anti-piracy law" adopted at the Diet takes effect. 
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of the Japanese reactionaries to dispatch more contingents in the future in the wake of the departure of the second contingent of the MSDF.
					
					 Japan already dispatched the SDF to the Indian Ocean under the signboard of "cooperation in the anti-terror war." This time it adopted the above-mentioned law, providing legal conditions for escalating the SDF troop dispatch overseas. 
					
					 Japan is crying out for "combating piracy" at present but no one can vouch that it would not repeat its past history of aggression.
					
					 What is ridiculous is that the Japanese reactionaries are working hard to cover up the SDF troop dispatch overseas aimed at overseas aggression with phraseologies of "international contribution" and "combating piracy."
					
					 They intend to grant the SDF dispatched as part of "peace-keeping forces" a bigger right to use weapons and allow it to use even heavy weapons. This goes to clearly prove that "peace-keeping operation" and "international contribution" on Japan's lip service are nothing but sophism intended to lay a springboard from which to launch overseas aggression.
					
					 Should the Japanese reactionaries launch reinvasion, oblivious of the bitter defeat the Japanese imperialists sustained in the past, they will perish deep under sea just as the militarists did.

articles.title: Removal of Obstacles to Reunification Called for
articles.content:
Removal of Obstacles to Reunification Called for
 Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- No significant progress can be expected in the south Korean people's patriotic activities for reunification, the inter-Korean relations and the movement for national reunification unless the fascist "National Security Law (NSL)" is repealed and the policy for confrontation with fellow countrymen rolled back in south Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 The successive dictators in south Korea have invoked the NSL as a lever for staying in power and a means for confrontation with fellow countrymen, the article notes, and goes on: The anti-reunification moves of traitor Lee Myung Bak far surpass the successive dictators in their vicious and persistent nature. 
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group revived the theory of "principal enemy" which proved bankrupt due to the trend of the June 15 era of reunification and gagged the media persons desirous of democracy and reunification.
					
					 The fascist clique mobilized the police and prosecution to quell the south Korean people's desire to achieve reunification through an alliance with the north. Not content with this, it is hurling even agents of "the Intelligence Service" into the operations to crack down upon the movements for reunification just as the successive dictators did.
					
					 The anti-reunification acts of traitor Lee Myung Bak find a vivid manifestation in the fact that he is getting more frantic in the racket for inter-Korean confrontation in league with foreign forces.
					
					 The Lee group unhesitatingly seeks to bring the war disaster to the fellow countrymen desirous of peace and reunification while escalating the military confrontation and tension on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme phase in a bid to hamstring any effort to improve the inter-Korean relations and accomplish the cause of national reunification and realize its wild ambition to invade the north at any cost. This is the criminal scenario of the group. 
					
					 With nothing can the group of traitors redeem the crimes it has perpetrated to block reunification and stifle the fellow countrymen, pursuant to the NSL and the policy for confrontation with compatriots.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Protest Fascist Rule
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Protest Fascist Rule
 Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Chairmen of the general students councils of 38 universities in south Korea made public a joint statement on July 16 in denunciation of the fascist oppressive actions by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.
					 The statement recalled that the puppet authorities mobilized police to take away Ri Won Gi, chairman of the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century, on July 15.
					
					 This violent suppression by the public security authorities is a political revenge on the federation which steadily staged the anti-"government" struggle in demand of reduction to half of the university registration fee and sponsored a concert for mourning the former "president", it charged.
					
					 Noting that not a few students were arrested by the police in July alone, the statement said that the present fierce oppressive atmosphere reminds one of the past era of dictatorship.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime is seeking to tide over the ruling crisis by reviving the fascist rule, but such attempt can never be realized, the statement asserted.
					
					 It urged the authorities to stop the fascist oppressive rule.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Troop Dispatch to Lebanon Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Troop Dispatch to Lebanon Flayed
 Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee for the Solidarity against Troop Dispatch grouping more than 40 civic and public organizations and the Democratic Labor Party and other political parties and organizations of south Korea called a press conference in Seoul on July 15 to denounce the puppet National Assembly for passing the bill on the troop dispatch to Lebanon.
					 Speakers at the press conference recalled that the presence of south Korean troops in Lebanon was due to expire on July 18 but the session of the "National Assembly" passed the bill calling for the extension of their presence till the end of the next year.
					
					 The "National Assembly" deserves public denunciation as it cleared the bill on the troop dispatch to support the U.S. in its war of aggression, shelving the issue of the people's livelihood now in the grip of a crisis, they declared, and went on:
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that gentries of the "Grand National Party" and some other lawmakers even asserted the need to ease the conditions for the NA carriage of bills on overseas troop dispatch. 
					
					 This assertion is aimed at providing conditions for dispatching armed forces to the shambles of the U.S. war of aggression including Afghanistan anytime without any limit, they deplored. 
					
					 They declared they could never tolerate such reckless actions of the NA as going against the expectation of the people desirous of peace, yielding to the U.S. pressure.

articles.title: Intensified Movement for Issuing Declarations on Situation Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Intensified Movement for Issuing Declarations on Situation Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- People from all walks of life in south Korea including university professors, workers, youth and students, religionists, teachers and artistes who participated in the movement for issuing declarations on the situation in protest against the misrule of traitor Lee Myung Bak held a rally in Seoul on July 16 to declare a more vigorous struggle for winning democracy of society.
					The participants in the rally accused Lee Myung Bak of persisting in his repressive rule as evidenced by the violation of the freedom of the people, his refusal to give up the projects to "improve four large rivers", reduction of the taxes to be paid by the rich and his moves to suppress media and put them under his control, etc.
					
					The authorities are running wild to crack down upon the participants in the movement for issuing declarations on the situation, but they can never calm down the angry voices of people reflecting their conscience, they declared. 
					
					They vowed to further intensify the above-said movement protesting against the evil acts of the Lee Myung Bak regime and the "Grand National Party" in the future.
					
					The on-going struggle can never succeed through actions of a few people alone, they held, calling upon the people from all walks of life in all areas to turn out in the movement to disclose the injustice of the repressive policy of the ruling forces and their policy of doing harm to the common people and give momentum to the atmosphere of actions for judging Lee Myung Bak.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Remembered in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Remembered in Different Countries
Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held in Mexico, Italy, Brazil, Switzerland and Austria between July 3 and 8 to commemorate the 15th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were celebrated works of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos on the immortal exploits of three commanders of Mt. Paektu and books and photos on the Korean people advancing under the banner of Songun.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meetings.
					
					 Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator (leader) of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, noted that Kim Il Sung wisely led the Korean revolution and the world revolution, holding high the banner of the Juche idea and the Songun idea all his life. He is always alive in the hearts of the world's progressive people for the immortal exploits he performed in accomplishing the human cause of independence, the speaker stressed.
					
					 Mauro Cazadio, general secretary of the Struggle for the Peace and Socialism of Italy, said that
						Kim Il Sung embarked on the road of revolution in his teens to liberate the country occupied by the Japanese imperialists and built a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence, in Korea.
					
					 Jose Gil de Almeida, president of the Brazilian Committee of Solidarity with the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, said that whenever looking up to the image of smiling Kim Il Sung they can not repress reverence for the people's leader who devoted all his life to the people.
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, noted that Kim Jong Il successfully realized the cause of perpetuating the memory of the President and turned the DPRK into a political and ideological and military power and is wisely leading the Korean people's cause of national reunification.
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meetings in Switzerland and Austria.

articles.title: Solidarity with Korean People Expressed in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean People Expressed in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, released a statement on July 14 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The statement praised the brilliant victory won by the Korean people in the hard-fought three-year war under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung as a very noteworthy event of the century in the history of humankind, stressing that it was a heroic example as it showed how to protect the dignity and happiness of the independent people from the imperialist aggression.
					
					 It said:
					
					The U.S. imperialists are now sparing no efforts to provoke another aggression war in the Korean Peninsula, oblivious of the lesson of their shameful defeat and prompted by their ambition for world hegemony. But their machinations are bound to face frustration and failure by the heroic struggle of the Korean army and people who have acquired powerful nuclear deterrent under the extraordinary Songun revolutionary leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the great brilliant commander of Songun.
					
					 Expressing the conviction that the Korean army and people will achieve greater successes in the efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation and reunify the country, the statement extended solidarity to the heroic Korean people making a history of invincibility in the struggle against imperialism and the U.S.

articles.title: Not Minding Hot Weather
articles.content:
North Hwanghae Provincial Taekwon-Do Team
 Pyongyang, July 20 (KCNA) -- The 12th national Taekwon-Do championship for Jongilbong Cup was held recently with success amid deep interests of the martial art players and sports fans of the DPRK.
					  The North Hwanghae Provincial Taekwon-Do Team has been known throughout the country as a competent one for the victories won by it in all contests since its formation. In the recent championship, too, it ranked first on the gold medal table.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam regresa a Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam regresa a Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 20 de julio (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, quien habia asistido a la XV Cumbre de los Paises No Alineados efectuada en Egipto, regreso el dia 20 a esta capital.
					En el aeropuerto le recibieron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la APS, Yang Hyong Sop, el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun, el embajador de la Republica Arabe de Egipto y el encargado de negocios a.i. de la Republica Popular China, acreditados en Corea.

articles.title: XV Cumbre de MNOAL expresa apoyo y solidaridad con la RPDC
articles.content:
XV Cumbre de MNOAL expresa apoyo y solidaridad con la RPDC
 Pyongyang, 20 de julio (ATCC) -- La XV Cumbre de los Paises No Alineados efectuada en Egipto expreso el total apoyo y solidaridad con los esfuerzos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea por la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					 En particular, los paises miembros del MNOAL reconocieron que no se necesitan mas las "conversaciones a 6 bandas" y decidieron no mencionarlas en el documento final.
					
					 Al respecto, la delegacion coreana reafirmo la inconmovible posicion del gobierno de la RPDC de quedarse fiel al ideal del MNOAL y contribuir activamente a su fortalecimiento y desarrollo expresando la conviccion de que este movimiento seguira enviando en el futuro tambien su invariable apoyo y solidaridad a la justa causa de Corea.

articles.title: Cayo lluvia torrencial en varias localidades de Corea
articles.content:
Cayo lluvia torrencial en varias localidades de Corea
 Pyongyang, 20 de julio (ATCC) -- Por la influencia de la depresion atmosferica trasladada desde la parte septentrional del Mar Oeste hasta el Mar Este de Corea cayeron la lluvia torrencial y chubasco en varias localidades de Corea.
					 Las precipitaciones reportadas desde las 12 del dia 17 hasta las 15 del dia siguiente en la ciudad de Pyongyang,  las zonas de Yodok de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur y de Maengsan, Sinyang, Phyongsong, Songchon y Tokchon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur fueron de 234, 287, 231, 202, 195, 191 y 187 mm, respectivamente.
					
					 Tambien, en las horas 0-3, 3-6, 6-9 y 9-12 del dia 18 fueron registradas mas de 50-130mm de las lluvias torrenciales en Pyongyang, Phyongsong, Sunchon y Maengsan de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur y en Yodok de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.
					
					 En particular, desde las 12 hasta las 15 de ese dia cayo el aguacero de 64-175mm en Pyongyang.

articles.title: Hay que tomar precaucion de la farsa anti-piratas de Japon
articles.content:
Hay que tomar precaucion de la farsa anti-piratas de Japon
Pyongyang, 20 de julio (ATCC) -- Si bien la sociedad internacional debe tomar precaucion de la pirateria, no ha de estar menos alerta a los reaccionarios japoneses que actuan demencialmente para agredir a ultramar pretextando las "medidas anti-piratas".
					Asi destaca el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual publicado este lunes.
					
					Hace poco, el segundo contingente de las "Fuerzas Maritimas de Autodefensa" de Japon partio al mar frente a Somalia pretextando la "prevencion de pirateria", senala el comentarista y prosigue:
					
					Se supone que esas filas arribaran a su destino a finales de este mes cuando entrara en vigor la "ley anti-pirateria" aprobada en la Dieta. 
					
					De esta manera, los reaccionarios japoneses intentan enviar sucesivamente a sus efectivos al mar frente a Somalia y otras partes del mundo, para lo cual dieron ya la condicion legal: la ley arriba mencionada.
					
					Japon ya ha enviado a sus "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" al Oceano Indico bajo el rotulo de la "cooperacion en la guerra antiterrorista". 
					
					Aunque Japon no se cansa de hablar de la "aniquilacion de los piratas", nadie puede asegurar que este pais con el antecedente de haber agredido a otros paises no repetira su pasado criminal.
					
					Lo descarado del caso es que los reaccionarios japoneses adornan el envio de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" a ultramar, encaminado a la agresion a ultramar, con las palabras de "contribucion internacional" y "prevencion de pirateria". 
					
					 Intentan ampliar el permiso dado a las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa", que cumplen la mision de mantenimiento de la paz, para el uso de armas para que ellas puedan emplear hasta las armas pesadas.
					
					 El hecho comprueba con toda claridad que el "mantenimiento de la paz" y la "contribucion internacional", de que habla tanto Japon, no pasan de ser una artimana para preparar el trampolin de la agresion a ultramar.
					
					 Si los reaccionarios japoneses emprenden de nuevo el camino de nueva agresion olvidando su amarga derrota sufrida en el siglo pasado, seran ahogados de modo insalvable junto con su fantasma militarista.
